election_record.label: New York 1803 Supervisor, Hudson

sub_unit.name: Hudson
sub_unit.note: The History of the City of Hudson, New York reports that that this "charter election [was] 'not warmly contested and [was] not a full vote.'"

"In five towns in this county, besides Hudson, viz. Canaan, Chatham, Gallatin, Granger, and Germantown, federal supervisors have been elected-in the other five, viz. Kinderhook, Livingston, Claverack, Hillsdale and Clermont, the democratic ticked was successful. From this result, we have reason to expect a very handsome federal majority at the county election." The Balance, and Columbian Repository (Hudson, NY). April 12, 1803.

election_record.reference: The Balance, and Columbian Repository (Hudson, NY). April 12, 1803.
Bradbury, Anna R. The History of the City of Hudson, New York. Hudson, NY: Record Printing, 1908.
